jinngine.geometry
Interface Geometry

All Superinterfaces:
BoundingBox
All Known Implementing Classes:
Box, ConvexHull, Sphere
public interface Geometry
extends BoundingBox

A general encapsulation for geometries used in jinngine. All implementation of geometry classes should implement this interface.

Method Detail

getBody

Body getBody()
Return the body that is associated with this Geometry instance

Returns:

setBody

void setBody(Body b)
Specify a body to be associated with this Geometry instance. Normally, it should not be necessary for the user to call this method directly. A geometry will have a body assigned automatically, when the geometry is added to the body

setLocalTransform

void setLocalTransform(Matrix3 R,
                       Vector3 b)
Set the local rotation for this geometry and displacement. The local transform is applied before the transform of the associated body is applied. This is used to rotate and translate geometries around in the object space. This transform must not include any scaling or other transformation types. That sort of transformations are to be handled internally by the geometry instance.

Parameters:
R - An orthonormal rotation matrix
b - Displacement vector

getLocalTransform

void getLocalTransform(Matrix3 R,
                       Vector3 b)
Get the local transform for this geometry. The rotation and displacement is assigned to the given matrix and vector.

Parameters:
R - Matrix to contain the rotation matrix of the local transform
b - A vector to contain the local transform displacement

getLocalTranslation

void getLocalTranslation(Vector3 t)
Return the local translation of this geometry

t -

setLocalScale

void setLocalScale(Vector3 s)
Set the local scale. Not all geometries will support scaling and/or non-uniform scaling

Parameters:
s -

getMass

double getMass()
Get the amount of mass for this geometry

getInertialMatrix

InertiaMatrix getInertialMatrix()
Compute the inertia tensor of this geometry. Note that this quantity is dependent on the mass of the geometry. The inertia tensor returned from this call must assume no local rotation or translation of the geometry instance.

getEnvelope

double getEnvelope()
Get the envelope size for this geometry. The envelope is related to narrow-phase contact determination and describes a positive distance to a geometry surface. If another geometry is placed within this distance, the two geometries are considered to be in contact.

Returns:

setEnvelope

void setEnvelope(double envelope)
Set the collision envelope size. The size of the collision envelope determines when contact points are generated by narrow-phase contact generation, and when broad-phase collision detection declares geometries to be in vicinity of each other. Too small envelopes results in often occurring penetrations, which are computationally more expensive to handle, and hurts the quality of animation. Too large envelopes will cause objects be appearing to hover above each other, and results in excessive amounts of contact points, which hurts both performance and accuracy of force computations.

getTransform

Matrix4 getTransform()
Get the final transform for this geometry, going from object space to world space.

Returns:
4x4 affine transformation matrix

getAuxiliary

java.lang.Object getAuxiliary()
Get the auxiliary reference. This reference is a way for the user to link geometry objects to some user space object

Returns:

setAuxiliary

void setAuxiliary(java.lang.Object aux)
Set the auxiliary reference. This reference is a way for the user to link geometry objects to some user space reference
